alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 30 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...INCREASED RELEASES FROM MCPHEE DAM AND HEAVY RUNOFF FROM SNOWMELT IN SMALLER TRIBUTARIES WILL LEAD TO HIGH FLOWS AND INCREASING RIVER LEVELS ALONG THE DOLORES RIVER BASIN UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... Areas along the Dolores River from McPhee Dam to the confluence with the Colorado River will be impacted by increasing river flows and river levels until further notice. Releases are increasing from McPhee Dam in preparation for elevated inflows due to the melting of this year`s snowpack. As temperatures increase into early next week...the melting of this snowpack will accelerate. Runoff along tributaries into the Dolores will bring additional flows to the reservoir releases. High flows may impact those living adjacent to these water ways, and can expect to see low land flooding into early next week. Recreational interest should be prepared for the impacts of high flows along the Dolores River. Camping areas and access to the river may become inaccessible or inundated. Please heed local advisories and closures. Stay tuned for additional statements and/or Watches and Warnings as river levels continue to rise.
